update sys_file_share
file_id=#{fileId ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
user_id=#{userId ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
stype=#{stype ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
area=#{area ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_person_id=#{createPersonId ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_date=#{createDate ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
ramarks=#{ramarks ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
status=#{status ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
audit_status=#{auditStatus ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
update_person_id=#{updatePersonId ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
update_date=#{updateDate ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
update_person_name=#{updatePersonName ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_person_name=#{createPersonName ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

bak2=#{bak2 ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
bak3=#{bak3 ,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
bak4=#{bak4 ,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update sys_file_share set file_id=#{fileId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_id=#{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, stype=#{stype,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, area=#{area,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_person_id=#{createPersonId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_date=#{createDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, ramarks=#{ramarks,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, status=#{status,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, audit_status=#{auditStatus,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_person_id=#{updatePersonId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_date=#{updateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_person_name=#{updatePersonName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_person_name=#{createPersonName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, bak1=#{bak1,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, bak2=#{bak2,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, bak3=#{bak3,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, bak4=#{bak4,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select id, file_id, user_id, stype, area, create_person_id, create_date, ramarks, status, audit_status, update_person_id, update_date, update_person_name, create_person_name, bak1, bak2, bak3, bak4 from sys_file_share where 1=1
and id like '%${id}%'
and file_id like '%${fileId}%'
and user_id like '%${userId}%'
and stype like '%${stype}%'
and area like '%${area}%'
and create_person_id like '%${createPersonId}%'
and create_date like '%${createDate}%'
and ramarks like '%${ramarks}%'
and status like '%${status}%'
and audit_status like '%${auditStatus}%'
and update_person_id like '%${updatePersonId}%'
and update_date like '%${updateDate}%'
and update_person_name like '%${updatePersonName}%'
and create_person_name like '%${createPersonName}%'
and bak1 like '%${bak1}%'
and bak2 like '%${bak2}%'
and bak3 like '%${bak3}%'
and bak4 like '%${bak4}%'
order by ${iSortCol} ${sSortDir_0}

select u.unit_id as id, u.unit_name as name,u.unit_relation as pid,u.unit_code as code, u.unit_level as levelCode, 'unit' as nodeType, '1' as bak1 from sys_unit u where unit_delflag = 0 union all select sys_user.user_id as id, sys_user.user_disp as name, sys_user_post.post_id as pid, sys_user.user_name as code, 100, 'user' as nodeType, isnull(sys_file_share.area) as bak1 from sys_user_unit,sys_user_post,sys_user left join sys_file_share on (sys_user.user_id = sys_file_share.area and sys_file_share.file_id = #{sSearch,jdbcType=VARCHAR}) where sys_user.user_delflag = 0 and sys_user.user_id = sys_user_post.user_id and sys_user.user_id=sys_user_unit.user_id and sys_user_unit.unit_id in ( select t.unit_id from sys_unit t where t.unit_delflag = 0 ) GROUP BY sys_user.user_id
union all select post_id as id, post_name as name, post_unit as pid, post_code as code, sys_post.post_level as nodeLevel, 'post' as nodeType, '1' as bak1 from sys_post where post_delflag = 0 and post_unit in ( select t.unit_id from sys_unit t where unit_delflag = 0 )
